element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text:
Resamples a raster layer to a lower resolution, aggregating the values of a group of cells.
This should be used in any case in which and a normal resampling will result in wrong values in the resulting layer, such as, for instance, if the variable contained in the input layer is the number of elements of a given class in each cell.

image.description: An example of aggregation. The input layer a) contains the number of individuals found in each cell. A normal resampling will yield wrong values (b). Using the aggregation algorithm with the 'add' method will yield the correct output layer with a coarser resolution (c)

element.name: METHOD
element.text: The aggregation operation to use * Add * Maximum * Mínimum

element.name: SIZE
element.text: The relation between the cellsize of the input layer and the one of the result layer. A value of 2 will cause the output layer to have a cellsize twice the cellsize of the input one, and each cell will represent the aggregated value of the 4 cells in a 2 by 2 window.
